alert.note: Alert for Bell; Knox; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 3:12AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in south central Kentucky, Whitley. In southeast Kentucky, Bell and Knox. * WHEN...Until 630 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 311 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Williamsburg, Gatliff, Polly Camp, Nevisdale, Packard, Dixie, Verne, Siler, Carpenter, Lucky, Wilkerson, Pearl, Saxton, Goins, Lot, Yaden, Frakes, Gausdale, Mountain Ash and Pleasant View. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
